I Have Worked In a Fast Food Restaurant
My First Job
By: flower4life
Written on August 5th, 2011 My first job, at 17, was at Long John Silvers. I worked there for a year and a half before quitting that job to go work at a Ponderosa Steakhouse. At Long John Silvers, I was a cashier. I sometimes felt like a janitor. I cleaned the bathrooms, scrubbed and mopped floors, and even took out the trash. Since I didn't have a good memory, I had to remember which customer got which meal, cause I had to bring them their food. I did train on preparing the orders on the screen and took orders on drive-thru. I'm a slow learner, so I messed up the orders a few times. When business is slow, I would prepare the frozen fish, chicken and shrimp for the cooks. I would even make the batter and hush puppy batter for the cooks too. I would also end up doing all the dishes, cause the men there say "that's women's work". I would stock up the condiment stand and stock it. I also stocked the desert pies in the cooler and made drinks for the customers and refilled the ice.
If money got short, from the register on my shift, I would repay it. I was voted most reliable, cause I would come into work no matter what. But when it came to cutting hours, I was first on the list. I was a good employee. It's my mouth that would get me into trouble. I would end up saying things that would get me into trouble. By: flower4life Age: 26-30 , Woman
